item.title: How_to_setup_hugo_part2
item.description: Front Matter You can define something called front matter in hugo which by default will be generated from archetypes/default.md file. You can define default variables in there in yaml/ json/ toml and these variables can be used across the html with {{.<Variable_name>}}, they are also called metadata about a page.You can also define global variables in config.toml file, and these can be accessed as {{.Site.Params.<variable_name>}}, with this i was able to define favicons, some site specific variables.

item.title: How_to_setup_hugo_part1
item.description: Introduction First thing is I was new to go and seemed overwhelmed when i put my hands in hugo, but eventualy after experimenting a lot this seemed a lot of fun. Hugo is the first static site generating framework i have ever used and it didn’t disappointed me. first thing i did was to download hugo for linux: sudo apt-get install hugo i am using ubuntu so check out the docs for downloading hugo based on the distribution you are using.
